content: So Microsoft bought LinkedIn because they are drowning in a sea of innovation because of sheer arrogance? Personally, the only value I find in LinkedIn is as an online resume and I’ve been using LinkedIn from nearly the beginning. Windows won the PC war which they invested everything into except that PC’s are nearly irrelevant in today’s market. Even the Office package is losing relevance because you really need a PC to take advantage of it fully. Not to mention 90% of users can achieve the same result with Google Docs and other free software.
